intro: Eremogone rigida, commonly known as the rigid eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its robust, woody stems and narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to survive in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the rainy season. Eremogone rigida is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, demonstrating its resilience to harsh environments.
